alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued February 21 at 2:34PM MST until February 23 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Cheyenne County. In Wyoming, Laramie Valley. * WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory from 11 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Thursday. Wind Chill Watch from Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in 10 minutes or less.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
